node.title: Grouping test from makefile
node.bodyText:
Hello,
I was wondering if it is possible to group sets of test based on variables set in the Makefile? Ive used the heavy flag in the test file before, but wasn't sure if there was some sort of more complex system for grouping different test. For example, sometimes i might want to couple with another moose app that provides addition physics kernels, i would like to test the coupled capabilities and have the TestHarness system pickup that they need to be tested automatically.
Thanks
Zack

Hello
You could:

add something to the test name or folder to tag it. Then have run_tests be ran as --re <tag> that will only run these tests
use the executable_pattern option to restrict tests to a certain name for what executable runs the test
I did that here https://github.com/idaholab/virtual_test_bed/blob/main/mrad/steady/tests

Guillaume

node.title: Build issues while using make -j4
node.bodyText:
When I try building the make file inside test using the make -j 4 command, an error pops up saying "MooseRevision.h: No such file or directory. Since, MooseRevision.h is an auto-generated file, I cannot download this file and place it in the appropriate directory as well. Further, I tried running the 'hello world' example code given in the moose repo and it was successful. How do I get past this error and build moose successfully on my Windows system?
Specifications: I am using [WSL]
I have attached the relevant screenshot
Yes, I activated the moose environment

Can you provide the results of the following commands:
conda info --all
which $CC $CXX
$CC -show
$CXX -show
If you are concerned with exposing your user id you can use post-text processing tools to mask it:
conda info --all | sed -e 's|youusername|username|g'
which $CC $CXX | sed -e 's|youusername|username|g'
$CC -show | sed -e 's|youusername|username|g'
$CXX -show | sed -e 's|youusername|username|g'

node.title: Finding the location of the NodalMaxValue
node.bodyText:
Hi All,
I hope this is a quick question.
I was trying to find a postprocessor for finding the max value of a variable in a certain domain and its coordinates.
Is there an easy way of doing this?
I am looking for something similar to TimeExtremeValue that can report either the extreme value or the time at which it occurred. What I need is the location instead of the time.
Thank you,
Roberto
I do not think that this exists, but it could be created within a single Reporter object: https://mooseframework.inl.gov/moose/syntax/Reporters/.
Great! Thank you.

node.title: Wave attenuation in Elastic Media
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
I'm studying 1D wave propagation in an elastic material. I'm sending a sinusoidal pulse with 5MHz frequency by displacing one of the boundaries using FuncionDirichletBC (similar to wave_newmark.i example in tests/dynamics folder). What I'm observing is that the wavefront gets attenuated quite a bit even though the Newmark time integration parameters are \beta = 0.25 and \gamma = 0.5. This effect seems to be less pronounced in lower frequencies though. I was wondering what mechanism is behind this that I'm missing and is there a way to avoid it?
Thanks,
Leon

Are you suggesting the Newmark beta time integrators is giving you incorrect solution? If so, could provide us with the correct/analytical solution to benchmark with?
If you are asking why wave attenuation is more pronounced with higher frequency inputs, then I honestly don't know (this isn't a moose question TBH). Tagging @cbolisetti in case he has some suggestions in this regard.

This sounds like a meshing issue. In wave propagation, you need to make sure that your mesh is fine enough to capture all the frequencies you want. Higher frequencies have a smaller wavelength, and if your mesh is too coarse it may not be able to resolve these wavelengths. In wave propagation for seismic waves in soil, we typically follow a rule of thumb of having 10 elements per wavelength for the highest frequency you want to capture. We refine the mesh based on this number. That should ensure that the frequencies you are aiming for will propagate without attenuation. Let us know if that works.
--
Sorry for the autocorrect errors earlier. Was typing on the phone while I was in a rush.

If you attach the input file, it will be easier to answer.
As suggested by others, try to refine the mesh and see if the effect goes away,
make sure there are no damping terms as described here:
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/tensor_mechanics/Dynamics.html
Make sure your time step is appropriate,
start with:
dt = element size / propagation velocity / 10
I have done wave propagation in moose and never
observed damping unless I introduced it on purpose.
Nicolò

Thanks @hugary1995 , @cbolisetti, and @ngrilli for the suggestions. It was the issue of time step size not being chosen small enough.
Cheers,
Leon

node.title: How to create a circular hole in square by mesh generator
node.bodyText:
Hi, team,
I wanted to create a circular hole in the square by mesh generator. I  used the following blocks from the input file, but the result was not good as seen below in Fig. 1. The expected result should be like a hole in Fig. 2.  Could you give me some advice on how to make it? Thanks very much.
[./gen]
type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
dim = 2
nx = 30
ny = 30
xmax = 60
ymax = 60
elem_type = TRI3
[../]
[./hole]
input = gen
type = ParsedSubdomainMeshGenerator
combinatorial_geometry = 'r:=sqrt((x-30)^2+(y-30)^2);if(r<=15,1,0)'
block_id = 1
[../]
[block_deleted]
type = BlockDeletionGenerator
input = hole
block = 1
[]
Fig.1

Fig.2

Hello
Use this mesh generator with the outer_box parameter
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/meshgenerators/ConcentricCircleMeshGenerator.html
then delete the center circle.
Guillaume

Hi,
I wanted to create a hole on a rectangular plate instead of a square plate. I found it is not straightforward. Can you give me some suggestions?
Thanks very much,
Kaijie
You can stitch meshes on the sides on the square mesh to make it a rectangle.

I am trying to solve it from your suggestion. I stitched the other one on the right side. [See below]. But now there is a boundary problem.
I wanted to apply pressure to the right, but actually, it was on the top. The input and mesh info are shown below. Can you help me? Thanks very much.
[Mesh]
[./square]
type = ConcentricCircleMeshGenerator
num_sectors = 10
radii = '    10    20'
rings = '4     10     6'
has_outer_square = on
pitch = 60
preserve_volumes = off
smoothing_max_it = 8
[]
[square_hole]
type = BlockDeletionGenerator
input = square
block = 1
[]
[./rect_top]
type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
dim = 2
ny = 24
nx = 10
xmin = 30
xmax = 50
ymin = -30
ymax = 30
[]
[./smg]
type = StitchedMeshGenerator
inputs = 'square_hole rect_top '
clear_stitched_boundary_ids = true
stitch_boundaries_pairs = 'right left'
parallel_type = 'replicated'
show_info = true
[]
[]

The following total 1 aux variables:
Fe
are added for automatic output by MaterialOutputAction.

Those mesh generators have pre-defined names and maybe the stitched ones dont match so well.
I would re-define the boundary you want using the sidesetmesh generators

Here is what I changed in the input file. But it showed an error. How should I further improve it? Thanks.

[Mesh]
[./rectR]
type = GeneratedMeshGenerator
dim = 2
ny = 24
nx = 10
xmin = 30
xmax = 50
ymin = -30
ymax = 30
[]
[./square]
type = ConcentricCircleMeshGenerator
num_sectors = 10
radii = '    10    20'
rings = '4     10     6'
has_outer_square = on
pitch = 60
preserve_volumes = off
smoothing_max_it = 8
[]
[squareHole]
type = BlockDeletionGenerator
input = square
block = 1
[]
[./smg]
type = StitchedMeshGenerator
inputs = 'squareHole rectR '
clear_stitched_boundary_ids = true
stitch_boundaries_pairs = 'right left'
parallel_type = 'replicated'
show_info = true
[]
[./block_1]
type = SideSetsAroundSubdomainGenerator
input = smg
block = 'rectR'
new_boundary = 'pull'
normal = '1 0 0'
[]
[./block_2]
type = SideSetsAroundSubdomainGenerator
input = block_1
block = 'squareHole'
new_boundary = 'fix'
normal = '-1 0 0'
[]
construct_side_list_from_node_list = true
[]

Can you run with --mesh-only mode, look at the mesh in paraview then examine what sidesets seem to be missing?
What is the name of the sideset you are trying to reference in the boundary condition?

Great. I am doing it. It is getting better.
With ParaView, I can see the element block ID (fig 1 below), but I cannot see boundary ID(fig 2 below). Where should I see boundary ID? Thanks.

which sideset is the boundary condition meant to be on ?
Any sideset missing in what you see in Paraview?
You should be able to see sidesets under Sets in the Properties tab

Now I can see the boundary from your suggestion.
I  noticed that, after stitching the meshes, though no boundary ids are missing, I could not apply the boundary id 3 (left). The error occurred:

Then I further added AllSideSetsByNormalsGenerator, and then I can apply the boundary id 3. Why is that? When should I use AllSideSetsByNormalsGenerator ? Thanks very much.

Those are probably removed because they are likely to not be valid anymore. Imagine if you had stitched on the left rather on the right, left would be in the middle of the domain.
Some generators will re-do those boundaries after they are applied I think
Great. It worked. I just made a 60x60 square with a 20 diameter hole. See below. Thanks very much.

node.title: Can MOOSE's data_file read data from an unstructured mesh (PiecewiseMulticonstant)?
node.bodyText:
Hi guys,
Just wondering if the 'data_file' option from PiecewiseMulticonstant and PiecewiseMultilinear can read data from an unstructured mesh?
It seems possible from the description, but when I checked the example, it seems like it only read the cartesian mesh value. Most of the data_file in the examples look like this (attached below)

Just wondering, is it possible for PiecewiseMulticonstant to read unstructured grid data from a file? for example in this format >> (x,y,z,value).
Note that I tried ReporterPointSource, but it introduces a source term to the variable, I only want to store data from a file, so I can use it elsewhere e.g. in BCs and Materials. @lynnmunday
Kind regards,
Traiwit

I think I ran into this issue before. If I remember correctly, the piecewisemultixxx readers only support data that is somehow structured due to the way it is read, i.e. x, y, z, t have to be somehow "monotone". This is required to do fast interpolation at locations not directly specified in the data file.
Imagine if you provide data in (x, y, z, value) format, that would require a projection "solve" to get the entire field.
That reporter point source is essentially relying on finite element shape functions to integrate Dirac sources. I don't think that's what you want.

Hi @hugary1995, I have a look at this: https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/utils/MooseUtils.html
I see MOOSE has CSVReader, but the only examples that come with it are 'Dirac sources', just wonder if we can apply this CSVReader to other applications?
Yes, of course. Just include "MooseUtils.h" in the file you want to use it.

node.title: Exit of code due to system crash running Contact Model
node.bodyText:
I have developed a contact model, and I get the following error when I run the code:
Reiniting because of ghosting ....                                                         [  5.17 s]
Crashed
Crashed: Exit code: 11
The geometry and meshing appear to be well developed. I am thinking that the error may be due to the time stepping and the domain size (modeled moving and colliding components on the order of 1mm) of the objects involved. I used the indentation example model as a basis for my model, maintaining all the defined functions as is. The scale of that 2D model and mesh are much larger that my 2D model. Any ideas on what may be causing the crash?

Hello
Could you be running out of memory?
If not could you please compile in debug mode (METHOD=dbg make) then run in a debugger to get a backtrace for the crash
(shorthand: gdb --ex run --ex bt --args executable -i input_file.i)
An error with the mesh file of the exodus code caused the crash. When certain node sets were selected in peacock, it would cause a crash of the software, which in turn would have to be restarted.
do you consistently get that crash? Are you comfortable providing us with a backtrace for it?

I realized the mesh file was causing the crash related to this problem. Thank you for your continued support.

Get Outlook for iOS<https://aka.ms/o0ukef>
…
________________________________
From: Guillaume Giudicelli ***@***.***>
Sent: Sunday, August 29, 2021 10:56:09 PM
To: idaholab/moose ***@***.***>
Cc: Wise, Tammy ***@***.***>; Author ***@***.***>
Subject: Re: [idaholab/moose] Exit of code due to system crash running Contact Model (#18718)


do you consistently get that crash? Are you comfortable providing us with a backtrace for it?

—
You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<https://protect2.fireeye.com/v1/url?k=182656b8-47bd6fa0-18261879-865f84946d4c-554069329110a5b4&q=1&e=e8dc680d-eaa1-4837-8094-469db7eb2bfa&u=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fidaholab%2Fmoose%2Fdiscussions%2F18718%23discussioncomment-1251770>, or unsubscribe<https://protect2.fireeye.com/v1/url?k=cf4ff495-90d4cd8d-cf4fba54-865f84946d4c-cb53ec8a68ed7bd5&q=1&e=e8dc680d-eaa1-4837-8094-469db7eb2bfa&u=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fnotifications%2Funsubscribe-auth%2FAJQ6AYRQIKEZHDZ7VEJCPR3T7LXMTANCNFSM5C6FORFQ>.

node.title: Follow up question about the boundary flux
node.bodyText:
Hi
I am simulating the microstructure evolution of the polycrystal two-phase separate system. I combined the Allen-Cahn and Cahn-Hillard equation into my system.
The boundary condition I set is NeumannBC. But from the video, you could see the upper grains disappeared, and the lower grain coarsen. So that is the reason I bring up the question for boundary condition did not work.
I agreed with the numerical error @jiangwen84 mention. (Thank you. I appreciated it.)
However, the problem I faced is a flux systematic non-zero, and it alternated the conclusion of the simulation.
Is there anything I should check?
-3.avi.zip
Thanks,
Emmeline

But from the video, you could see the upper grains disappeared, and the lower grain coarsen. So that is the reason I bring up the question for boundary condition did not work.

No, this isn't the correct logic to me. If you apply zero flux, then all you get is global conservation of concentration. This is indeed observed in your video.
In your video, the movement of the interface is likely driven by something in your free energy, instead of the Neumann BC.

node.title: Coupling multiple domains into a source term
node.bodyText:
what source files would I utilize to impose a source term on an interface boundary that is coupled with the variable in the neighboring domain? See figure for governing problem

So far, I am thinking I will need to use Auxvariable to hold the value of the P interface and pass it into the source kernel of the domain.

Hello
You should have a look at InterfaceKernels.
What kind of source is it? Diffusive? A current proportional to a the value of the variable?
Guillaume
it is a permeation source term. Where the accumulation or depletion of the species is dependent on the interface variables i.e pressure .

ok seems like you will want to work with an interface kernel then. Note that you can have some of the coefficients be defined completely in the kernel or be defined as material properties, depending on what is most convenient for you
Could you elaborate more on the type of interface kernels, I.e what specific class files would you recommend. I am still in the process of learning moose.

Also I do not believe interface kernels are the route, because I would need to describe the source term (permeation) in the respected domain with its dependency of value on the respected interface ( pressure).
the permeation term, is it a surface term or a volumetric one?
Surface Term ( mass transfer of u1 into domain 2) k*(c-c^*)

I would look at the conjugate heat transfer interface kernel.
If it werent for that pressure dependence (variables from the other side of the interface right?) I would say a boundary condition would work.

node.title: assigning properties to each elements (for drainage/Porousflow)
node.bodyText:
Hi all,
I'd like to assign the particular value of drainage to each element instead of each block/surface.
by the value of drainage, I mean C in PorousFlowPiecewiseLinearSink
https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/porous_flow/boundaries.html
I checked https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/porous_flow/heterogeneous_models.html
but it assigns permeability base on the location (x-y), I want it to be based on the elementID.
It would be ideal if I can import value from like csv file into moose like (elementID, property value)
Not sure if this's possible?
Thank you guys.
Kind regards,
Traiwit
Would DiracKernels help?

I tried to look into this, it doesn't look like what I want. I checked, most of DiracKernels specify at the location (x,y,z).
Let's step back to a more generic question, is it possible for MOOSE to assign material properties base on elementID instead of blockID?
Kind regards,
Traiwit
I don't think it is. Can you explain more why you can't use (x,y,z) coordinates for this?

It's just easier for us to integrate MOOSE to our framework, since we normally assigning properties base on elementID via Abaqus.
Question: if we assign properties base on location using data_file: PiecewiseMultilinear PiecewiseMulticonstant, where would the properties be assigned to? at the node of at the element?
Thanks you.
Kind regards,
Traiwit

Hi Traiwit,
Material properties are assigned to the elements and you can easily get the coordinates of the elementID when you generate the mesh or in paraview.
You can assign spatial distributed properties with the workflow Andy and I made a while ago. I made a simple example for you. Seems to work fine.
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1zneEcLT-LpScxtw4HUdKI1_akEwoXauI?usp=sharing
Cheers,
Jose

by 'the coordinates of the elementID' you mean the centroid of the element right?
Thank you for the link, I will have a look tomorrow and get back to you.
Kind regards,
Traiwit

Hi @josebastiase
I checked the files, they are nice and highly likely to be applicable to my problem.
I have a quick question regarding the Python script, say if I have a CSV file with drainage value and its location like this >>> (x, y, z, drainage)
how should I reformat it so MOOSE can read it using the block below?
[C_fcn]
    type = PiecewiseMulticonstant
    direction = 'left right'
    data_file = C.data
  []

Thanks again.
Kind regards,
Traiwit

Take a look at https://mooseframework.inl.gov/source/functions/PiecewiseMulticonstant.html
and some examples https://github.com/idaholab/moose/tree/next/test/tests/functions/piecewise_multilinear

@cpgr sorry for being stubborn, but how should I work around this if I have unstructured mesh (like the one below)? It seems like the examples only show cartesian data file


From this link: https://mooseframework.inl.gov/modules/porous_flow/heterogeneous_models.html
I guess I need to use em2ex (https://github.com/cpgr/em2ex) then, not sure what it is, but ill give it a go.

This pre-processing must be performed using software that can take a geological model and convert it into a form that PorousFlow can read. One example of a pre-processing code that may be used is em2ex. This code converts a reservoir model in either Eclipse format or cell centered csv format to an Exodus mesh that can used in PorousFlow.

Please suggest if there is an alternative way to work with the problem.
Thank you.
Kind regards,
Traiwit

I assume that each cell has a different property value, rather than each cell in the red domain having the same property?
In that case, I'm not sure how you can easily achieve this in MOOSE without making a custom AuxKernel or Material. And I don't think em2ex will help - it is made for going from a Petrel model to an exodus model.
Outside writing a custom AuxKernel/Material,I have used meshio before to quickly modify meshes before using in MOOSE. It reads Abaqus files and exports Exodus, so it might be possible to read the Abaqus mesh, assign the property values based on element id (if these aren't read directly), and export to exodus. Then you can read in those values as AuxVariables, and proceed as normal?
Or maybe PiecewiseMultiConstant works with unstructured grids if you give it centroids? I don't know, but it might be worth trying first?
@GiudGiud i agree, source term in a PDE isn't what I want, I want something that I can impose to material properties or BCs

@GiudGiud is there any update on this issue?
A quick question, is there a read_file.C or (data_file.C) file or something that I can look into? I checked PiecewiseMultiConstant.C but couldn't find that data_file option in there.
Kind regards,
Traiwit

No new object to do that afaik.
I m still convinced best way would be to add a spatialValue routine to the CSVReader then just use that in a SpatialUOAux

Dear @Traiwit
Whenever I want to assign a material property based on element ID,
what I do is mimicking the approach used for the crystal plasticity code.
You can use the UserObject:
https://github.com/idaholab/moose/blob/next/modules/tensor_mechanics/src/userobjects/ElementPropertyReadFile.C
to read a file of properties element by element.
If you have a structured mesh, the element ID will grow along the x axis, then y axis, then z axis.
Then you can use the user object into a material object, like in:
https://github.com/idaholab/moose/blob/next/modules/tensor_mechanics/src/materials/crystal_plasticity/ComputeElasticityTensorCP.C
This is the way you can obtain your property based on element ID:
_read_prop_user_object->getData(_current_elem, 0);
An example input file is:
https://github.com/idaholab/moose/blob/next/modules/tensor_mechanics/test/tests/crystal_plasticity/monolithic_material_based/crysp_user_object.i
In the case of crystal plasticity, this method allows to assign Euler angles based on element ID,
but you can use the same for any other material property.
Trust this helps,
Nicolò

Thank you @ngrilli I believe this is very close to what I want.
I have some questions, maybe @GiudGiud can also help me out as well.


I check the examples I see that only crystal plasticity related files have _read_prop_user_object->getData(_current_elem, 0); in their .C file, does this mean I have to add this myself to other material properties .C files such as PorousFlowPermeabilityConst and PorousFlowPorosityConst


is it possible to convert what I read from ElementPropertyReadFile into function format? one of my goals is to impose the property's value to flux_function in PorousFlowPiecewiseLinearSink


          [./water_grad_right]
            type = PorousFlowPiecewiseLinearSink
          variable = porepressure
          boundary = 'right'
          pt_vals = '0 1e9'
          multipliers = '0 1e9' 
          flux_function = xxxx ******HERE*******
          fluid_phase = 0
          [../]

Thank you gents
Kind regards,
Traiwit

@GiudGiud thank you for your reply, i'm working on the first part, and I'm getting there :)
a quick question on the 2nd point, is there an example of creating 'a new function'?
Kind regards,
Traiwit

I dont think there's an example. I would just copy-paste an existing one then modify it. For what you want you could start from SolutionFunction.C. There might be better starting points but this one seems close enough
EDIT: I had a look, the tutorial covers kernels, materials and auxvariables, but not functions. You can still have a look at tutorial 1 if you have not

@GiudGiud Thank you
with my limited knowledge of C++, I'm slowly working on it (still failing to compile)
I will come back as ask if I'm really stuck.
Kind regards,
Traiwit

Hi guys,
I'm having a problem converting the type of input parameter. I'm trying to follow what @ngrilli suggested #18542 (comment).
In the example, the code read ElementPropertyReadFile into RealVectorValue
but what I want now is to convert what I read in ElementPropertyReadFile to RealTensorValue (shown below)
It compiles fine, but when I run the input file I have this problem >
*** ERROR ***
The parameter "permeability" is being retrieved before being set.

I notice that what I read from .CSV isn't in tensor format, I've also tried to convert the csv cell into tensor (X 0 0 0 X 0 0 0 X) but then ElementPropertyReadFile won't read.

Please suggest if you know how to work with this issue, sorry for my limited knowledge of C++, hope I could explain it better.
Kind regards,
Traiwit

what's in your input for this block?
permeability seems declared and retrieved properly here,

Hi @GiudGiud, that is when i didnt give permeability value into the block to it,

but when I do, I have this error instead
  [./permeability_top]
    type = PorousFlowPermeabilityConstTC
    permeability = '1e-10 0 0   0 1e-10 0   0 0 1e-10'
    read_prop_user_object = prop_read
  [../]


I notice that permeability is  (x 0 0 0 x 0 0 0 x), but I only supply a single number into   _permeability_qp[_qp]
Hence the error occurs, but I'm not sure how to fix this

If you retrieve a parameter with getParam it needs to be set in the input file, or it needs a default in the validParams
Your error is a hypre error. Let's see if @fdkong has seen it before.

Is there another routine than getData you could use for that object?
If not you can always fill the tensor component by component

Hi @GiudGiud,
I finally got it to works now, thank you for going through this with me

Now I still need to import what I read from CSV via ElementPropertyReadFile  to Function format so then I can apply it to PorousFlowPiecewiseLinearSink
I tried SolutionFunction.C but it takes different type of userobject (SolutionUserObject rather than ElementPropertyReadFile)
Kind regards,
Traiwit
